author: Justin Baer
title: Legg Mason Discloses Potential Settlement Charge From Libya Operations
text:
Legg Mason Inc. said Wednesday it soon would resolve U.S. investigations into a unit’s business practices in Libya and it had taken a $67 million charge to last quarter’s earnings to pay for a possible settlement.
The money manager wrote in its annual regulatory filing that it “will shortly complete negotiations with both the U.S. Department of Justice and the [Securities and Exchange Commission] staff to resolve a Foreign Corrupt Practices Act investigation” into Permal Group’s investment business with Libyan government...
